xxl.core.collections.containers.recordManager

Class Page

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.collections.containers.recordManager.Page
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Convertable

    public class Page
extends Object
implements Convertable
    This class represents a page that can contain multiple records. It implements the convertable interface so that Page objects can be serialized using the write and read methods. The enclosed Records objects are simple wrappings of byte-arrays and can be used user-dependent.

    This class is closly coupled with the RecordManager. Remember that reserves does not not have to be forwarded to the page. So, the page Usually cannot determine if an identifyer is really free. This is the task of the RecordManager.

    Some comments:

    • In each page there can be at most Short.MAX_VALUE Records. The number of each record is inside the interval [0,Short.MAX_VALUE].
    • If the size of the page is smaller or equal than Short.MAX_VALUE, then the serialization uses Short-Values for positions inside the Page.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Page

        public Page(int pageSize)
        Creates an empty page.
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • getSize

        public static int getSize(int pageSize,
                          int numberOfRecords,
                          int numberOfBytesUsedByRecords)
        Calculates and returns the size (# of bytes) of the used space inside the Page. To determine, if a new record will fit into the Page, call getSize(pageSize, numberOfRecords+1, oldSize+record.size) and compare the result with the pageSize.
        Parameters:
        pageSize - the size of the page in bytes.
        numberOfRecords - the number of Records which are/should be inside a Page.
        numberOfBytesUsedByRecords - the number of bytes used by the records itself (the data part).
        Returns:
        number of bytes.

      • getMaxRecordSize

        public static int getMaxRecordSize(int pageSize)
        Calculates the size of the biggest record that could be stored inside the Page.
        Parameters:
        pageSize - the size of the page in bytes.
        Returns:
        size of the biggest record in bytes.

      • getNumberOfRecords

        public short getNumberOfRecords()
        Returns the number of all records: normal records and link records.
        Returns:
        the number of records.

      • getNumberOfBytesUsedByRecords

        public int getNumberOfBytesUsedByRecords()
        Returns the number of bytes which is used for the data of the records.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes used by the Records.

      • getNumberOfLinkRecords

        public short getNumberOfLinkRecords()
        Returns the number of link records (the return value is inside the range [0,getNumberOfRecords()]).
        Returns:
        the number of link records within the page.

      • getFreeRecordNumber

        protected short getFreeRecordNumber()
        Calculates a new id for a new Record (seldomly/never used!). O(n log n)
        Returns:
        returns an unused record id.

      • getMaxRecordId

        protected short getMaxRecordId()
        Calculates the current maxId (seldomly used!). Complexity: O(n)
        Returns:
        the maximum record id: -1 iff the Page is empty, else a value >= 0.

      • readHeader

        public void readHeader(DataInput dataInput)
        Reads just the header-informations. The remaining bytes (the serialized records)) of the stream can be reconstructed by using the readTail(dataInput) method. That strategy enables, that we can see how much free space this page has or if it contains a searched record, before we reconstruct the whole page. That mechanism is more efficient than reading always the whole page.
        Parameters:
        dataInput - DataInput from which the header informations are read.

      • readTail

        public void readTail(DataInput dataInput)
        Reads the serialized Records. This method expects, that the stream contains no header informations and that these informations are already present in this page Object i.e. by using the readHeader() Method. This arises from the following reasond: We dont have to read the whole page if we only want to know the amount of free space in this page. If the page has enough free space, we can reconstruct this page by using this readTail method. That mechanisms is more efficient than reading always the whole page.
        Parameters:
        dataInput - DataInput from which the tail information is read.

      • read

        public void read(DataInput dataInput)
        Reads the whole stream. At the beginning of the stream this method expects header informations.
        Specified by:
        read in interface Convertable
        Parameters:
        dataInput - the dataInput stream holding the serialized page (header and data)

      • write

        public void write(DataOutput dataOutput)
        Serializes the Page into the dataOutputStream.
        Specified by:
        write in interface Convertable
        Parameters:
        dataOutput - DataOutput to which the Page is written.

      • insertRecord

        public void insertRecord(Block record,
                         short newRecordNr,
                         boolean isLinkRecord)
        Inserts a Record into this Page.
        Parameters:
        record - the record that should be inserted
        newRecordNr - the wished recordNr, if not available a new one will be calculated
        isLinkRecord - determines if the record is a normal record (with data) or a link record (true).

      • insertEmptyRecord

        public void insertEmptyRecord(short newRecordNr,
                              int size)
        Inserts an empty Record into this Page.
        Parameters:
        newRecordNr - the wished recordNr, if not available a new one will be calculated
        size - the size of the record that should be inserted.

      • update

        public void update(Block record,
                   short recordNr,
                   boolean isLinkRecord)
        Overwrites the Record with id recordNr with the given record. Note: It's the problem of the record-manager to check whether there's enough free space in this page, if the size of the new record is biggger than the size of the old record.
        Parameters:
        record - The new record.
        recordNr - The number of the record inside the page.
        isLinkRecord - determines if the record is a normal record (with data) or a link record (true).

      • remove

        public void remove(short recordNr)
        Removes the Record with recordNr from this Page.
        Parameters:
        recordNr - the recordNr of the Record that should be removed
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - - if a Record with the recordNr is not in this Page.

      • getRecord

        public Block getRecord(short recordNr,
                       boolean[] isLinkRecord)
        Returns the Record with the given recordNr. Throws a Exeption is there's no Record with that id.
        Parameters:
        recordNr - Number of the Record inside the Page
        isLinkRecord - returns as its first element, if the record is a link record or not (Java has no easy and performant way to return two values from a method).
        Returns:
        the desired Record

      • isUsed

        public boolean isUsed(short recordNr)
        Checks whether there's a Record with the given recordNr in this page.
        Parameters:
        recordNr - The number of the record.
        Returns:
        true if there's a Record with the given recordNr in this page, else false.

      • getRecordSize

        public int getRecordSize(short recordNr)
        Returns the size of the Record with the number recordNr. Throws a NoSuchElementException if there's no Record with the specified recordNr.
        Parameters:
        recordNr - the nr of the Record in this Page.
        Returns:
        the size of the Record with the given recordNr
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if there's no Record with the specified recordNr.

      • idsWithoutLinkRecords

        public Iterator idsWithoutLinkRecords()
        Returns an Iterator over the record-ids of this page.
        Returns:
        an Iterator over the record-ids of this page.
